place.name: GREAT COATES
place.gazetteerText: COATES (Great), a parish in Caistor district, Lincoln; on the Humber, and on the Grimsby and Hull railway, 2½ miles W of Great Grimsby. It has a station on the railway, and a post office under Ulceby. Acres, 4, 480; of which 1,875 are water. Real property, £4, 259. Pop., 206. Houses, 45. The property is divided among a few. The parish is a meet for the Laceby harriers. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £580.* Patron, Sir R. Sutton, Bart. The church has two brasses, and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
